markers.name: HOOK
markers.note:
Range 0–3s. Open with the clearest value: a visual or line that states *what this is* and *why it matters* in plain language.
— Cuts: Cut every ~0.8–1.2s; micro-jolt ≤0.7s ok.

markers.name: DRAW
markers.note:
Range 4–6s. Add one new angle or contrast that deepens curiosity; avoid repeating the hook wording.
— Cuts: Quicker trims ~0.6–0.9s; 1 brisk insert per beat of idea.

markers.name: INTERRUPT #1
markers.note:
Micro pattern break (≤0.7s). Quick visual flip/cut-in that resets attention without derailing flow.
— Cuts: ≤0.6s micro-jolt.

markers.name: COMMIT / PAYOFF
markers.note:
Range 3–5s. Deliver the promised clarity: tight demo/result/visual that proves the premise.
— Cuts: Let proof breathe 1.2–1.8s; single cut-ins ≤0.5s.

markers.name: INTERRUPT #2
markers.note:
Second micro jolt; invert framing or swap angle to avoid glide to the finish.
— Cuts: ≤0.6s micro-jolt.

markers.name: HOOK
markers.note:
Range 0–3s. Punchy premise stated plainly; no hedging.
— Cuts: 0.9–1.3s cadence.

markers.name: DRAW
markers.note:
Range 4–6s. Add context or an unexpected contrast that still supports the hook.
— Cuts: 0.7–1.0s cadence; allow 1 contrast cut ≤0.5s.

markers.name: INTERRUPT #1
markers.note:
Early micro jolt (≤0.7s). Keeps the mid-section from flattening.
— Cuts: ≤0.6s burst.

markers.name: COMMIT / PAYOFF #1
markers.note:
Range 3–5s. First clean delivery moment—proof, reveal, or tight before/after.
— Cuts: 1.4–2.0s; 1–2 inserts ≤0.5s.

markers.name: SECOND HOOK
markers.note:
Range 2–4s. Re-hook with a sharper angle or upside; avoid redundancy.
— Cuts: 0.8–1.1s, punchier than first hook.

markers.name: INTERRUPT #2
markers.note:
Quick flip after second hook to prevent plateau.
— Cuts: ≤0.6s micro-jolt.

markers.name: DEVELOP
markers.note:
Range 6–8s. Stack 1–2 supporting beats; no rabbit holes.
— Cuts: 1.0–1.4s trims; chain 2 beats max.

markers.name: INTERRUPT #3
markers.note:
Penultimate jolt to prime the close.
— Cuts: ≤0.6s micro-jolt.

markers.name: HOOK
markers.note:
Range 0–3s. Plain-speak promise; strong visual identity.
— Cuts: 1.0–1.4s cadence.

markers.name: DRAW
markers.note:
Range 4–6s. Elevate intrigue via contrast/constraint/benefit.
— Cuts: 0.9–1.2s; maintain forward pressure.

markers.name: INTERRUPT #1
markers.note:
Micro reset to avoid 6–10s slump.
— Cuts: ≤0.6s micro-jolt.

markers.name: COMMIT / PAYOFF #1
markers.note:
Range 3–5s. Hard clarity moment #1.
— Cuts: 1.5–2.2s; inserts ≤0.6s.

markers.name: SECOND HOOK
markers.note:
Range 2–4s. Alternate entry point for scrollers; new phrasing.
— Cuts: 0.9–1.2s; keep phrasing fresh.

markers.name: INTERRUPT #2
markers.note:
Quick subversion; keep rhythm varied.
— Cuts: ≤0.6s micro-jolt.

markers.name: DEVELOP A
markers.note:
Range 6–8s. Expand with one concise supporting angle.
— Cuts: 1.1–1.6s trims; avoid meander.

markers.name: INTERRUPT #3
markers.note:
Reset cadence before last stretch.
— Cuts: ≤0.6s micro-jolt.

markers.name: DEVELOP B
markers.note:
Range 5–7s. Second support; avoid duplication.
— Cuts: 1.1–1.6s trims; escalate or contrast.

markers.name: INTERRUPT #4
markers.note:
Final micro jolt before close.
— Cuts: ≤0.6s micro-jolt.

markers.name: FINAL PAYOFF / LOOP
markers.note:
Range 1.5–3.0s. Clean visual loop or crisp CTA.
— Cuts: 0.9–1.3s; land on loopable motion.

markers.name: HOOK (Signature Visual)
markers.note:
Range 0–3s. Iconic pose/move or bold text: instantly tells what vibe this is.
— Cuts: 0.7–1.0s; snap on motion apex.

markers.name: DRAW (Aesthetic Lift)
markers.note:
Range 4–6s. Add a quick look change, location shift, or camera energy.
— Cuts: 0.6–0.9s; switch angle/location quickly.

markers.name: INTERRUPT #1
markers.note:
≤0.7s. Micro cut/whip/push to reset attention.
— Cuts: ≤0.6s micro-jolt.

markers.name: COMMIT / PAYOFF
markers.note:
Range 3–5s. Tight performance moment or strong transition that feels 'earned'.
— Cuts: 1.2–1.6s on best performance bar; cut-ins ≤0.5s.

markers.name: INTERRUPT #2
markers.note:
Second micro flip to avoid slide to credits.
— Cuts: ≤0.6s micro-jolt.

markers.name: HOOK
markers.note:
Range 0–3s. Punchy premise stated plainly; no hedging.
— Cuts: 0.9–1.2s; hit downbeat moves.

markers.name: DRAW
markers.note:
Range 4–6s. Add context or an unexpected contrast that still supports the hook.
— Cuts: 0.7–1.0s; texture/move alternation.

markers.name: INTERRUPT #1
markers.note:
Early micro jolt (≤0.7s). Keeps the mid-section from flattening.
— Cuts: ≤0.6s micro-jolt.

markers.name: COMMIT / PAYOFF #1
markers.note:
Range 3–5s. First clean delivery moment—proof, reveal, or tight before/after.
— Cuts: 1.4–1.9s; preserve groove.

markers.name: SECOND HOOK
markers.note:
Range 2–4s. Re-hook with a sharper angle or upside; avoid redundancy.
— Cuts: 0.8–1.1s; fresh pose/transition.

markers.name: INTERRUPT #2
markers.note:
Quick flip after second hook to prevent plateau.
— Cuts: ≤0.6s micro-jolt.

markers.name: DEVELOP
markers.note:
Range 6–8s. Stack 1–2 supporting beats; no rabbit holes.
— Cuts: 1.0–1.4s; 2-beat mini-sequence.

markers.name: INTERRUPT #3
markers.note:
Penultimate jolt to prime the close.
— Cuts: ≤0.6s micro-jolt.

markers.name: HOOK
markers.note:
Range 0–3s. Plain-speak promise; strong visual identity.
— Cuts: 1.0–1.3s; signature move early.

markers.name: DRAW
markers.note:
Range 4–6s. Elevate intrigue via contrast/constraint/benefit.
— Cuts: 0.9–1.2s; keep energy rising.

markers.name: INTERRUPT #1
markers.note:
Micro reset to avoid 6–10s slump.
— Cuts: ≤0.6s micro-jolt.

markers.name: COMMIT / PAYOFF #1
markers.note:
Range 3–5s. Hard clarity moment #1.
— Cuts: 1.5–2.1s; show payoff clean.

markers.name: SECOND HOOK
markers.note:
Range 2–4s. Alternate entry point for scrollers; new phrasing.
— Cuts: 0.9–1.2s.

markers.name: INTERRUPT #2
markers.note:
Quick subversion; keep rhythm varied.
— Cuts: ≤0.6s micro-jolt.

markers.name: DEVELOP A
markers.note:
Range 6–8s. Expand with one concise supporting angle.
— Cuts: 1.1–1.5s per move sequence.

markers.name: INTERRUPT #3
markers.note:
Reset cadence before last stretch.
— Cuts: ≤0.6s micro-jolt.

markers.name: DEVELOP B
markers.note:
Range 5–7s. Second support; avoid duplication.
— Cuts: 1.1–1.5s, environment interplay.

markers.name: INTERRUPT #4
markers.note:
Final micro jolt before close.
— Cuts: ≤0.6s micro-jolt.

markers.name: FINAL PAYOFF / LOOP
markers.note:
Range 1.5–3.0s. Clean visual loop or crisp CTA.
— Cuts: 0.9–1.2s loop close.

markers.name: PRINCIPLES — Scenes/Segments
markers.note:
• First-frame clarity (<2s): who/where/what.
• Keep trims tight; avoid >1.5s dead air between ideas.
• Use bridges for invisible cuts (movement/sound/action).
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Micro-jolt cadence
markers.note:
Insert a quick change every ~5–8s (angle/motion/graphic) to refresh attention.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Loop seam awareness
markers.note:
Plan an end frame that re-enters cleanly if the video loops on social.
— Cuts: ≤0.8s button; clean loop frame.

markers.name: PRINCIPLES — ShotFX
markers.note:
• Composite first, grade after (minimize double processing).
• Track → refine → blend: favor natural edges over harsh feather.
• Use AI assists sparingly; keep facial texture/natural motion.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Mask edge awareness
markers.note:
Mind edges during fast motion; avoid halos/boil. Prefer soft, directional feathering.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Look exploration
markers.note:
Try one alternate 'beauty vs grit' treatment for options later.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Seam check (Difference)
markers.note:
Use a Difference/Blend preview to locate seam crawl; nudge mask or warp to match.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Shadows / occlusion
markers.note:
Ensure correct layer order where subjects cross; paint/contact-shadow fix if needed.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Grain / blur match
markers.note:
Match grain and motion blur between plates; add grain last so edges integrate.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Continuity glance
markers.note:
Watch hands/feet for pops at the seam during moves; micro-transform if necessary.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: PRINCIPLES — ShotFX
markers.note:
• Composite first, grade after (minimize double processing).
• Track → refine → blend: favor natural edges over harsh feather.
• Use AI assists sparingly; keep facial texture/natural motion.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Mask edge awareness
markers.note:
Mind edges during fast motion; avoid halos/boil. Prefer soft, directional feathering.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Look exploration
markers.note:
Try one alternate 'beauty vs grit' treatment for options later.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Skin texture
markers.note:
Do not blur: borrow texture from nearby skin; keep pores. Add tiny monochrome grain if needed.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Temporal sanity
markers.note:
If the head moves, use a short temporal patch (few frames) rather than one still.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Color/Specular
markers.note:
Match micro highlights; reduce spec hotspots with gentle curve, not blur.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: SELECTS — Workflow
markers.note:
Pass 1: reject hard misses. Pass 2: keep only 'A' material. Pass 3: choose alts.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Labeling & notes
markers.note:
Use ⭐/color or keywords in Notes: hook, verse, cutaway, reaction, alt, NG.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Cut points
markers.note:
Prefer cuts on motion/syllables; add 6–12f handles to each pick for safety.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Sync sanity
markers.note:
Mark claps/peaks; verify frame-accurate sync against waveform/transients.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Stringout pointers
markers.note:
Range-mark best beats; leave short gaps between ideas to hear pacing honestly.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Lyric map
markers.note:
Note bar:line references in Notes (e.g., V1L3). Keep best energy + clean lipsync.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Angle variety
markers.note:
Favor angle changes on rhyme landings; avoid 3+ consecutive takes of same lens.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Micro-ramps
markers.note:
Tag rampable hits (impact/word) for later 90–110% time-micro to sell emphasis.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: SELECTS — Workflow
markers.note:
Pass 1: reject hard misses. Pass 2: keep only 'A' material. Pass 3: choose alts.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Labeling & notes
markers.note:
Use ⭐/color or keywords in Notes: hook, verse, cutaway, reaction, alt, NG.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Cut points
markers.note:
Prefer cuts on motion/syllables; add 6–12f handles to each pick for safety.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Sync sanity
markers.note:
Mark claps/peaks; verify frame-accurate sync against waveform/transients.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Stringout pointers
markers.note:
Range-mark best beats; leave short gaps between ideas to hear pacing honestly.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Texture diversity
markers.note:
Collect movement textures (hands, lights, environment). Avoid duplicates of same move.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Parallax / depth
markers.note:
Prefer foreground passes & reveals; tag any perfect whip/cover for transitions.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Cutaway purpose
markers.note:
Each B-roll pick should illustrate a lyric/idea or hide an A-roll cut.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: HOOK (Hero Fit Moment)
markers.note:
Range 0–3s. One striking silhouette or texture close-up that defines the look.
— Cuts: 0.7–1.0s; silhouette read first.

markers.name: DRAW (Detail Contrast)
markers.note:
Range 4–6s. Switch to fabric, accessories, or motion to add dimension.
— Cuts: 0.6–0.9s; alternate texture/motion.

markers.name: INTERRUPT #1
markers.note:
≤0.7s. Quick angle/tempo flip.
— Cuts: ≤0.6s micro-jolt.

markers.name: COMMIT / PAYOFF
markers.note:
Range 3–5s. Full-body reveal or clean style transition.
— Cuts: 1.2–1.6s full-body; detail cut-ins ≤0.5s.

markers.name: HOOK (Look Identity)
markers.note:
Range 0–3s. State the vibe: street/clean/retro/etc. via a hero frame.
— Cuts: 0.8–1.1s.

markers.name: DRAW (Texture/Movement)
markers.note:
Range 4–6s. Fabric motion or accessory interaction.
— Cuts: 0.7–1.0s; emphasize fabric motion.

markers.name: INTERRUPT #1
markers.note:
≤0.7s. Angle/location micro switch.
— Cuts: ≤0.6s micro-jolt.

markers.name: COMMIT / PAYOFF #1
markers.note:
Range 3–5s. Full outfit clarity.
— Cuts: 1.3–1.8s head-to-toe.

markers.name: SECOND HOOK (Alt Styling)
markers.note:
Range 2–4s. Secondary combo or layer change.
— Cuts: 0.8–1.1s; new layer/prop.

markers.name: DEVELOP
markers.note:
Range 6–8s. 1–2 beats: close-ups, pocket pulls, hem, shoe detail.
— Cuts: 1.0–1.4s; 2 detail beats max.

markers.name: HOOK (Statement Frame)
markers.note:
Range 0–3s. Pose, lensing, or lighting that telegraphs tone.
— Cuts: 1.0–1.3s.

markers.name: DRAW (Cutaway Detail)
markers.note:
Range 4–6s. Textures, stitching, hardware.
— Cuts: 0.9–1.2s; stitching/hardware.

markers.name: INTERRUPT #1
markers.note:
Micro jolt.
— Cuts: ≤0.6s micro-jolt.

markers.name: COMMIT / PAYOFF #1
markers.note:
Range 3–5s. Head-to-toe moment.
— Cuts: 1.5–2.1s.

markers.name: SECOND HOOK
markers.note:
Range 2–4s. Alternate palette/prop.
— Cuts: 0.9–1.2s.

markers.name: DEVELOP A
markers.note:
Range 6–8s. Movement sequence: walk, turn, sit.
— Cuts: 1.1–1.5s per move.

markers.name: DEVELOP B
markers.note:
Range 5–7s. Environment integration.
— Cuts: 1.1–1.5s; environment read.

markers.name: FINAL PAYOFF / LOOP
markers.note:
Range 1.5–3.0s. Seamless loop or subtle CTA.
— Cuts: 0.9–1.2s.

markers.name: PRINCIPLES — Fashion
markers.note:
• Silhouette first (clean read, full body).
• Then detail: fabric/texture/hardware micro-shots.
• Motion beauty: walk/turn/glance for flow & attitude.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Motion beauty
markers.note:
Feature a fluid move here (turn/step/hair/garment ripple).
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Thumbnail candidates
markers.note:
Flag strong stills for covers/carousels later.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Silhouette first
markers.note:
Pick one clean full-body read per look; then 2–3 detail shots (fabric, hardware).
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Motion beauty
markers.note:
Walk/turn/hair moments with flow; reject frames that crush garment shape.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Color/texture continuity
markers.note:
Note lighting shifts; tag candidates for thumbnail/carousel.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: SELECTS — Workflow
markers.note:
Pass 1: reject hard misses. Pass 2: keep only 'A' material. Pass 3: choose alts.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Labeling & notes
markers.note:
Use ⭐/color or keywords in Notes: hook, verse, cutaway, reaction, alt, NG.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Cut points
markers.note:
Prefer cuts on motion/syllables; add 6–12f handles to each pick for safety.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Sync sanity
markers.note:
Mark claps/peaks; verify frame-accurate sync against waveform/transients.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Stringout pointers
markers.note:
Range-mark best beats; leave short gaps between ideas to hear pacing honestly.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Silhouette first
markers.note:
Pick one clean full-body read per look; then 2–3 detail shots (fabric, hardware).
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Motion beauty
markers.note:
Walk/turn/hair moments with flow; reject frames that crush garment shape.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Color/texture continuity
markers.note:
Note lighting shifts; tag candidates for thumbnail/carousel.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: HOOK (Plain-Speak Claim)
markers.note:
Range 0–3s. One-sentence promise with a direct face angle.
— Cuts: 0.8–1.1s; cut on phrase ends.

markers.name: DRAW (Setup in One Line)
markers.note:
Range 4–6s. Short context that *increases* curiosity.
— Cuts: 0.7–1.0s; keep fillers trimmed.

markers.name: INTERRUPT #1
markers.note:
≤0.7s. Insert quick B-roll or on-screen receipt.
— Cuts: ≤0.6s micro-jolt.

markers.name: COMMIT / PAYOFF
markers.note:
Range 3–5s. The clear takeaway or micro demo.
— Cuts: 1.2–1.7s; overlay receipts ≤0.5s.

markers.name: HOOK (Outcome First)
markers.note:
Range 0–3s. Lead with result/benefit plainly.
— Cuts: 0.9–1.2s.

markers.name: DRAW (Short Context)
markers.note:
Range 4–6s. Add one surprise fact or contrast.
— Cuts: 0.8–1.1s; one surprise fact.

markers.name: INTERRUPT #1
markers.note:
≤0.7s. Pattern break: quick insert or angle swap.
— Cuts: ≤0.6s micro-jolt.

markers.name: COMMIT / PAYOFF #1
markers.note:
Range 3–5s. First clear point.
— Cuts: 1.4–2.0s.

markers.name: SECOND HOOK
markers.note:
Range 2–4s. Re-articulate upside in fresher words.
— Cuts: 0.8–1.1s; new phrasing.

markers.name: DEVELOP
markers.note:
Range 6–8s. One supporting example; avoid tangents.
— Cuts: 1.0–1.4s; single example.

markers.name: HOOK (Punchy Thesis)
markers.note:
Range 0–3s. No hedging.
— Cuts: 1.0–1.3s.

markers.name: DRAW (Angle Boost)
markers.note:
Range 4–6s. Sharpen tension without jargon.
— Cuts: 0.9–1.2s.

markers.name: INTERRUPT #1
markers.note:
Micro reset.
— Cuts: ≤0.6s micro-jolt.

markers.name: COMMIT / PAYOFF #1
markers.note:
Range 3–5s. Clear, specific point.
— Cuts: 1.5–2.1s.

markers.name: SECOND HOOK
markers.note:
Range 2–4s. New phrasing for late arrivals.
— Cuts: 0.9–1.2s.

markers.name: DEVELOP A
markers.note:
Range 6–8s. Example or tiny case.
— Cuts: 1.1–1.5s.

markers.name: DEVELOP B
markers.note:
Range 5–7s. Short application/implication.
— Cuts: 1.1–1.5s.

markers.name: FINAL PAYOFF / LOOP
markers.note:
Range 1.5–3.0s. Tight loop or ask.
— Cuts: 0.9–1.2s.

markers.name: PRINCIPLES — Talking Head
markers.note:
• Lead with the point (don't bury context).
• Tighten fillers; preserve natural cadence.
• Support hard ideas with B-roll overlays; hide jump cuts.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: B-roll window
markers.note:
Consider an overlay here to illustrate or cover a breath cut.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Pacing & captions
markers.note:
Keep line breaks on phrase boundaries; punch keywords with subtle zoom/audio emphasis.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: PRINCIPLES — ShotFX
markers.note:
• Composite first, grade after (minimize double processing).
• Track → refine → blend: favor natural edges over harsh feather.
• Use AI assists sparingly; keep facial texture/natural motion.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Mask edge awareness
markers.note:
Mind edges during fast motion; avoid halos/boil. Prefer soft, directional feathering.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Look exploration
markers.note:
Try one alternate 'beauty vs grit' treatment for options later.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Lighting continuity
markers.note:
Replicate falloff & vignette; add tiny shadow where object was so wall doesn't look 'too clean'.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Grain / noise
markers.note:
Sample target area's noise level; add back after composite to prevent 'cutout' look.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: SELECTS — Workflow
markers.note:
Pass 1: reject hard misses. Pass 2: keep only 'A' material. Pass 3: choose alts.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Labeling & notes
markers.note:
Use ⭐/color or keywords in Notes: hook, verse, cutaway, reaction, alt, NG.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Cut points
markers.note:
Prefer cuts on motion/syllables; add 6–12f handles to each pick for safety.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Sync sanity
markers.note:
Mark claps/peaks; verify frame-accurate sync against waveform/transients.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Stringout pointers
markers.note:
Range-mark best beats; leave short gaps between ideas to hear pacing honestly.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Message spine
markers.note:
Select crisp claims and proofs; cut fillers/false starts/breath-tails.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Cut on gesture
markers.note:
Hide jump cuts under head/hand motion; tag phrases needing B-roll coverage.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Caption sync
markers.note:
Keep phrase boundaries clean for line breaks; avoid mid-word cuts.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: SELECTS — Workflow
markers.note:
Pass 1: reject hard misses. Pass 2: keep only 'A' material. Pass 3: choose alts.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Labeling & notes
markers.note:
Use ⭐/color or keywords in Notes: hook, verse, cutaway, reaction, alt, NG.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Cut points
markers.note:
Prefer cuts on motion/syllables; add 6–12f handles to each pick for safety.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Sync sanity
markers.note:
Mark claps/peaks; verify frame-accurate sync against waveform/transients.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Stringout pointers
markers.note:
Range-mark best beats; leave short gaps between ideas to hear pacing honestly.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Texture diversity
markers.note:
Collect movement textures (hands, lights, environment). Avoid duplicates of same move.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Parallax / depth
markers.note:
Prefer foreground passes & reveals; tag any perfect whip/cover for transitions.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Cutaway purpose
markers.note:
Each B-roll pick should illustrate a lyric/idea or hide an A-roll cut.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: HOOK (Moment in Progress)
markers.note:
Range 0–3s. Drop viewer into motion; avoid slow preamble.
— Cuts: 0.7–1.0s; cut on action changes.

markers.name: DRAW (What's Next?)
markers.note:
Range 4–6s. Tease destination/task contrast.
— Cuts: 0.7–1.0s; tease movement.

markers.name: INTERRUPT #1
markers.note:
≤0.7s. Tempo flip.
— Cuts: ≤0.6s micro-jolt.

markers.name: COMMIT / PAYOFF
markers.note:
Range 3–5s. Satisfying micro-resolution (arrive/complete/transition).
— Cuts: 1.2–1.6s micro-resolution.

markers.name: HOOK (Drop-In)
markers.note:
Range 0–3s. Start mid-action.
— Cuts: 0.9–1.2s.

markers.name: DRAW (Mini Arc)
markers.note:
Range 4–6s. Set tiny objective/change.
— Cuts: 0.8–1.1s.

markers.name: INTERRUPT #1
markers.note:
≤0.7s. Micro reset.
— Cuts: ≤0.6s micro-jolt.

markers.name: COMMIT / PAYOFF #1
markers.note:
Range 3–5s. Hit a checkpoint.
— Cuts: 1.4–1.9s.

markers.name: SECOND HOOK
markers.note:
Range 2–4s. New micro-goal.
— Cuts: 0.8–1.1s.

markers.name: DEVELOP
markers.note:
Range 6–8s. Texture beats (ambient, details).
— Cuts: 1.0–1.4s.

markers.name: HOOK (Live Snapshot)
markers.note:
Range 0–3s. Immediate immersion.
— Cuts: 1.0–1.3s.

markers.name: DRAW (Tension/Contrast)
markers.note:
Range 4–6s. Set a tiny tension to resolve.
— Cuts: 0.9–1.2s.

markers.name: INTERRUPT #1
markers.note:
Quick changeup.
— Cuts: ≤0.6s micro-jolt.

markers.name: COMMIT / PAYOFF #1
markers.note:
Range 3–5s. Satisfy the first micro-goal.
— Cuts: 1.5–2.0s.

markers.name: SECOND HOOK
markers.note:
Range 2–4s. Lure late scrollers.
— Cuts: 0.9–1.2s.

markers.name: DEVELOP A
markers.note:
Range 6–8s. Environment & texture.
— Cuts: 1.1–1.5s.

markers.name: DEVELOP B
markers.note:
Range 5–7s. Human beat or detail set.
— Cuts: 1.1–1.5s.

markers.name: FINAL PAYOFF / LOOP
markers.note:
Range 1.5–3.0s. Loopable exit/enter.
— Cuts: 0.9–1.2s.

markers.name: PRINCIPLES — Day in the Life
markers.note:
• Intent fast: what's happening today?
• Micro-scenes > montage blur: 3–6s beats with clear purpose.
• End each cycle with a small resolution or tease.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Atmos pass
markers.note:
Insert textures/hands/ambient to vary pacing without losing thread.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Transition moment
markers.note:
Natural hop to the next micro-scene (movement/sound change).
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Cycle closure
markers.note:
Leave a resolved beat that can loop if needed.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: PRINCIPLES — ShotFX
markers.note:
• Composite first, grade after (minimize double processing).
• Track → refine → blend: favor natural edges over harsh feather.
• Use AI assists sparingly; keep facial texture/natural motion.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Mask edge awareness
markers.note:
Mind edges during fast motion; avoid halos/boil. Prefer soft, directional feathering.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Look exploration
markers.note:
Try one alternate 'beauty vs grit' treatment for options later.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Specular continuity
markers.note:
Rebuild highlight streaks across the patch; tiny dodge/burn beats blur every time.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Motion blur
markers.note:
Match shutter blur on fast finger moves; composite pre-blur, not post.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Final grain
markers.note:
Add matched grain over the composite; check at 100% zoom.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: SELECTS — Workflow
markers.note:
Pass 1: reject hard misses. Pass 2: keep only 'A' material. Pass 3: choose alts.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Labeling & notes
markers.note:
Use ⭐/color or keywords in Notes: hook, verse, cutaway, reaction, alt, NG.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.note:

— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Stringout pointers
markers.note:
Range-mark best beats; leave short gaps between ideas to hear pacing honestly.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Micro-scenes
markers.note:
Collect clear begin→middle→end beats (3–6s each).
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Entrances/Exits
markers.note:
Favor shots with natural in/out motion for seamless chaining.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: SELECTS — Workflow
markers.note:
Pass 1: reject hard misses. Pass 2: keep only 'A' material. Pass 3: choose alts.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Labeling & notes
markers.note:
Use ⭐/color or keywords in Notes: hook, verse, cutaway, reaction, alt, NG.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Cut points

— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Stringout pointers
markers.note:
Range-mark best beats; leave short gaps between ideas to hear pacing honestly.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Travel rhythm
markers.note:
Wheels/doors/steps ambience; grab a few speed & direction variations.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Landmarks
markers.note:
Tag 1–2 location wides for context; hold for 0.5–1.0s longer.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: SELECTS — Workflow
markers.note:
Pass 1: reject hard misses. Pass 2: keep only 'A' material. Pass 3: choose alts.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Labeling & notes
markers.note:
Use ⭐/color or keywords in Notes: hook, verse, cutaway, reaction, alt, NG.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Cut points
markers.note:
Prefer cuts on motion/syllables; add 6–12f handles to each pick for safety.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Sync sanity
markers.note:
Mark claps/peaks; verify frame-accurate sync against waveform/transients.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Stringout pointers
markers.note:
Range-mark best beats; leave short gaps between ideas to hear pacing honestly.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Hands & steam
markers.note:
Close-ups of pour/steam; use them to reset cadence later.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Loop beats
markers.note:
Pick a looping action (stir, sip, door swing) for intros/outros.
— Cuts: ≤0.8s button; clean loop frame.

markers.name: HOOK (Signature Sound/Move)
markers.note:
Range 0–3s. Instantly show the identity: pad hit, finger drum, or motif.
— Cuts: 0.7–1.0s; cut on transients.

markers.name: DRAW (Layer or Constraint)
markers.note:
Range 4–6s. Tease a layer you'll add or a flip you'll attempt.
— Cuts: 0.6–0.9s; UI/hands ~0.5s.

markers.name: INTERRUPT #1
markers.note:
≤0.7s. Micro switch to screen/overhead.
— Cuts: ≤0.6s micro-jolt.

markers.name: COMMIT / PAYOFF
markers.note:
Range 3–5s. Small but satisfying musical 'click' (layer locks, groove snaps).
— Cuts: 1.2–1.6s groove lock.

markers.name: HOOK (Instant Identity)
markers.note:
Range 0–3s. The 'ohhh' sound/move first.
— Cuts: 0.9–1.1s.

markers.name: DRAW (What You'll Build)
markers.note:
Range 4–6s. Promise the flip: key/tempo/session context (fast).
— Cuts: 0.7–1.0s; context fast.

markers.name: INTERRUPT #1
markers.note:
≤0.7s. Angle/UI micro cut.
— Cuts: ≤0.6s micro-jolt.

markers.name: COMMIT / PAYOFF #1
markers.note:
Range 3–5s. First groove lock.
— Cuts: 1.4–1.9s.

markers.name: SECOND HOOK
markers.note:
Range 2–4s. Catchier motif/turn.
— Cuts: 0.8–1.1s.

markers.name: DEVELOP
markers.note:
Range 6–8s. Add/remove tension: short fills, mute plays, knob rides.
— Cuts: 1.0–1.4s; short fills ≤0.5s.

markers.name: HOOK (Immediate Sauce)
markers.note:
Range 0–3s. Start at the most *you* sound.
— Cuts: 1.0–1.2s.

markers.name: DRAW (Set the Game)
markers.note:
Range 4–6s. 'Here's the flip' in one line.
— Cuts: 0.9–1.2s.

markers.name: INTERRUPT #1
markers.note:
Micro cut/angle.
— Cuts: ≤0.6s micro-jolt.

markers.name: COMMIT / PAYOFF #1
markers.note:
Range 3–5s. First lock moment.
— Cuts: 1.5–2.0s.

markers.name: SECOND HOOK
markers.note:
Range 2–4s. Stronger motif.
— Cuts: 0.9–1.2s.

markers.name: DEVELOP A
markers.note:
Range 6–8s. Arrange mini-arc.
— Cuts: 1.1–1.5s.

markers.name: DEVELOP B
markers.note:
Range 5–7s. Short performance burst.
— Cuts: 1.1–1.5s.

markers.name: FINAL PAYOFF / LOOP
markers.note:
Range 1.5–3.0s. Loop land.
— Cuts: 0.9–1.2s.

markers.name: PRINCIPLES — Cook-Ups
markers.note:
• Introduce motif quickly; show the 'why' of the tweak.
• Reveal progress visually (UI, hands, waveform/meter).
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Arrangement choice
markers.note:
Commit to a direction; avoid endless A/B meanders.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: UI / sound insert
markers.note:
Highlight a plugin/knob/waveform moment that sells the change.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Vibe spike
markers.note:
Create a small peak (camera move, slow-mo, quick cut burst).
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.note:
Highlight a plugin/knob/waveform moment that sells the change.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Vibe spike
markers.note:
Create a small peak (camera move, slow-mo, quick cut burst).
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: PRINCIPLES — Cook-Ups
markers.note:
• Introduce motif quickly; show the 'why' of the tweak.
• Reveal progress visually (UI, hands, waveform/meter).
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Arrangement choice
markers.note:
Commit to a direction; avoid endless A/B meanders.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: PRINCIPLES — ShotFX
markers.note:
• Composite first, grade after (minimize double processing).
• Track → refine → blend: favor natural edges over harsh feather.
• Use AI assists sparingly; keep facial texture/natural motion.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Mask edge awareness
markers.note:
Mind edges during fast motion; avoid halos/boil. Prefer soft, directional feathering.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Look exploration
markers.note:
Try one alternate 'beauty vs grit' treatment for options later.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Pad feedback
markers.note:
Duplicate LED/hit feedback under the correct hand; avoid double-lit pads.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Audio truth
markers.note:
If printing live audio, comp the correct take for each hit; no double hits.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Micro parallax
markers.note:
If hands drift apart, micro-warp one plate to the other near the seam.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: PRINCIPLES — ShotFX
markers.note:
• Composite first, grade after (minimize double processing).
• Track → refine → blend: favor natural edges over harsh feather.
• Use AI assists sparingly; keep facial texture/natural motion.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Mask edge awareness
markers.note:
Mind edges during fast motion; avoid halos/boil. Prefer soft, directional feathering.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Look exploration
markers.note:
Try one alternate 'beauty vs grit' treatment for options later.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Motion blur & flicker
markers.note:
Match shutter blur; optional subtle 0.5–1% luminance flicker to sell emissive panel.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Moire / aliasing
markers.note:
Add tiny grain and 0.2–0.4 px defocus to kill moire while keeping UI crisp enough.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Light spill
markers.note:
Add light wrap onto bezels/fingers at bright frames; very low opacity.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: SELECTS — Workflow
markers.note:
Pass 1: reject hard misses. Pass 2: keep only 'A' material. Pass 3: choose alts.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Labeling & notes
markers.note:
Use ⭐/color or keywords in Notes: hook, verse, cutaway, reaction, alt, NG.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Cut points
markers.note:
Prefer cuts on motion/syllables; add 6–12f handles to each pick for safety.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Sync sanity
markers.note:
Mark claps/peaks; verify frame-accurate sync against waveform/transients.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Stringout pointers
markers.note:
Range-mark best beats; leave short gaps between ideas to hear pacing honestly.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Clean hits
markers.note:
Choose takes with clear pad contact & stable wrist; reject occluded hits.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: UI context
markers.note:
Grab short UI pans for key/plugin; make sure values are legible.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Energy & eye line
markers.note:
Prefer takes with micro-groove and camera engagement; avoid dead stares.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Reveal moments
markers.note:
Pick sequences that set up/pay off arrangement changes.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Transient truth
markers.note:
Select crisp knob turns/clicks; align to grid transient if needed.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.

markers.name: Variety
markers.note:
Gather a library: short/long whooshes, reverse, button, cloth, hands.
— Cuts: Cut every ~1.1s; chain 2–3 beats.
